description.narrative: The International Development Association (IDA) is an international financial institution which offers concessional loans and grants to the world's poorest developing countries. The IDA is a member of the World Bank Group and complements the existing the existing International Bank for Reconstruction and Development by lending to developing countries which suffer from the lowest gross national income, from troubled creditworthiness, or from the lowest per capita income. Funding under this initiative represents a contribution to IDA17 debt arrears clearance which is a mechanism for IDA eligible countries in arrears in repayments to re-engage with the World Bank under certain circumstances. The total value of this initiative is $10.64 million to be expensed over the period 13 June 2014 to 30 June 2017.
